intro: Lachenalia nardousbergensis, commonly known as the Nardousberg lachenalia, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically blooms in spring, producing clusters of white or pale pink flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
